What crops is this useful for?: The product is not intended for use on crops. It is a nonselective herbicide for total vegetation control in noncrop areas such as industrial sites, lumberyards, petroleum tank farms, around farm buildings, along fence lines, and similar areas.
First aid information?: If in eyes, rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. If swallowed, call a poison control center or doctor immediately. If on skin or clothing, rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. If inhaled, move person to fresh air and call a poison control center or doctor for further treatment advice.
What special restrictions are placed on: The pesticide may adversely affect non-target plants. It should not be applied directly to water, to areas where surface water is present, or to intertidal areas below the mean high water mark. It should not be used in areas where soils are permeable, particularly where the water table is shallow, as it may result in groundwater contamination.
What PPE should I wear?: All mixers, loaders, and applicators must wear a long-sleeved shirt and long pants, shoes plus socks, protective eyewear (goggles or face shield), and chemical-resistant gloves.
How, where, and on what crop should I us: The product is intended for use in noncrop areas for total vegetation control. It can be applied before or after plant growth begins. The effectiveness is dependent on rainfall to move the chemical into the root zone. The product will not provide herbicidal action unless application is immediately followed by watering the area with at least % " of water or application of the product just prior to a rain event sufficient to penetrate the root system of the target vegetation.
How does the product have to be stored o: The product should be stored in a dry place. Wastes resulting from use of this product must be disposed of on site or at an approved waste disposal facility. The container should be cleaned before final disposal.
